discoveredAssets: 127.0.0.1:5000 - Dalgona Challenges web application (Werkzeug 1.0.1 Python 3.11.2) - Port 5000
127.0.0.1:5000 / - Main index page with challenge links - Active

targets.objective: Analyze web application for IDOR vulnerabilities, authentication weaknesses, CSRF vulnerabilities, and business logic flaws. Check for challenge submission mechanism and user data handling. Investigate referenced /xss25 endpoint access and routing logic.
targets.rationale: Main entry point to the application. Root endpoint is the primary attack surface for web-based vulnerabilities including authentication bypass, session management issues, and input validation flaws. Referenced challenge endpoint not accessible suggesting potential routing bypass or privilege escalation vectors.

keyFindings: [LOW] Dalgona Challenges application running on Werkzeug 1.0.1 (Python 3.11.2) - outdated version with known vulnerabilities
[LOW] Referenced endpoint /xss25 returns 404 error despite being linked from main page - possible incomplete deployment or routing misconfiguration
[LOW] No API endpoints discovered (.../api/, .../api/v1/, etc.) - all API paths return 404
[LOW] No authentication mechanism visible on main page - potential for IDOR vulnerabilities in backend if implemented
[LOW] Static asset serving enabled but directory listing disabled - proper configuration
[LOW] POST method not allowed on root endpoint (405 Method Not Allowed)
[LOW] No debug endpoints, configuration files, or sensitive information disclosure vectors identified
[LOW] No discovery files (robots.txt, sitemap.xml, swagger.json) - minimal surface area
